Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with any current browser!?
Reviews.Author: OND of OMT
Reviews.Content: I will be the first to admit that I'm not a networking expert or anything, but I am fairly decent at setting up network devices and working on network related issues. That being said, this camera was a pain to set up. After setting everything up and getting to the point where it should be working, it didn't. I then spent another 2 hours on the phone with TRENDnet's tech support, only to have them tell me that the camera is not compatible with Internet Explorer 8, and I needed to use a computer that had Internet Explorer 7. It also does not support full motion video when using Firefox, only 1 still picture per second (what's the point?), and will not work with Safari. Needless to say I returned the camera to Amazon for a refund and got a Sharx Security VIPcella-IR SCNC2607 wireless network camera (also from Amazon) and had it up and running within 10 minutes of taking it out of the box. It's a little pricier, but the time saved setting it up, and the video quality (which was much better than I expected) makes it totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: broken item
Reviews.Author: Henry Alfau Rivas "hbalfau"
Reviews.Content: the camera arrived broken, and according to the type of damage appears to have been released so by the supplier, so I want the prompt repayment of money paid for the cameras.
